snippet: The deficit increased to $39.1 billion, up 0.3 percent from December’s revised $39 billion deficit, the Commerce Department reported on Friday.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that United States' trade deficit widened slightly in January 2014 as rise in imports of oil and other foreign goods offset solid increase in imports; deficit increased to $39.1 billion, up 0.3 percent from December’s revised $39 billion deficit.
lead_paragraph: The deficit increased to $39.1 billion, up 0.3 percent from December’s revised $39 billion deficit, the Commerce Department reported on Friday.

headline.main: Oil Imports Push U.S. Trade Deficit Higher
headline.print_headline: Oil Imports Push U.S. Trade Deficit Higher
